result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy L Cravillion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on Ct. 1 including including court appointed attorney fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

To pay the costs of the action on Ct. 5 including court appointed attorney fees.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with K.M.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: 90 days STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.
To perform 40 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

Defendant Amy L Cravillion in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of plea agreement. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty pleas to Counts 1, 5. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 5. Counts 2, 3, 4 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court questions Defendant on waiver of PSI, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Amy L Cravillion in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Meier feels matter will resolve, requests time to review discovery material with defendant. Atty Meier requests another status in 30 days. State has no objection. Court commends defendant on being current with her atty fee payments. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Defense Discovery Demand
from Atty Meier requesting to reschedule Prelim./Waiver of Prelim. to accomodate defendant's work orientation. Court reschedules.
Defense waives reading of Information and stands mute to all charges. Court enters not guilty plea to all counts on defendants behalf.   Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Amy L Cravillion in court with attorney Rick Brian Meier.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.
from ADA Korb asking to reschedule 2/10/16 prelim. as Inv. Gilson is not available that day. Court reschedules.

Defendant Amy L Cravillion in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing.   Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA. Discussion on legal representation as defendant is facing several felony charges. Defendant would now like to talk to public defender to see if she qualifies. Defendant leaves to talk to Atty Gerbers. Defendant back in court, indicates she does not qualify for PD representation. Defendant would like time to contact an atty. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 11:45 am.
